title: "ilux" - Customised Looking geometric font
content:
I know this looks pretty customised, but i’m pretty positive i’ve spotted some fonts on a font library website that had elements that looked exactly like the X. any good suggestions guys?

 [‹ (x) Spencer's openface Art Deco serif font - Mona Lisa {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183518/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41053 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Worldways Social Marketing website - Amasis, Interstate {Akira, Jan E, Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183518/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41029 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content: There are no two-colored fonts. It can only be done by combining two seperate fonts that are designed to work together (like Rosewood/Rosewood Fill for example).

You might be thinking of [Braggadocio.](http://web.archive.org/)

- Lex
This is very similar to Bifur by A. M. Cassandre. IHOF revived it as [P22 Bifur](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183518/http:/typographica.org/000918.php).
ah thats the one thanks! yea it can be made two colors because the font comes with two seperate sets to be layered on top of eachother. thank you all!
Louise Fili did this logo as well as another one, Ecco, using the same type style. I just went through a few of her books and couldn’t find it, but I swear there is a showing of it.

This ecco? I always see it on books and love it!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007183518im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ecco_5935.jpg)
